docs.title: Slot: sample linkage (sample_link)
docs.text:
A unique identifier to assign parent-child, subsample, or sibling samples. This is relevant when a sample or other material was used to generate the new sample.

URI: nmdc_sub_schema:sample_link Alias: sample_link

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot HostAssociatedInterface host_associated dh_interface no SedimentInterface sediment dh_interface no SoilInterface soil dh_interface no BuiltEnvInterface built_env dh_interface no MiscEnvsInterface misc_envs dh_interface no PlantAssociatedInterface plant_associated dh_interface no AirInterface air dh_interface no HcrCoresInterface hcr_cores dh_interface no HcrFluidsSwabsInterface hcr_fluids_swabs dh_interface no WaterInterface water dh_interface no BiofilmInterface biofilm dh_interface no WastewaterSludgeInterface wastewater_sludge dh_interface no SampIdNewTermsMixin Mixin with SampIdNew Terms no

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: String

  • Recommended: True

  • Regex pattern: [^\:\n\r]+\:[^\:\n\r]+

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: Value IGSN:DSJ0284

docs.title: Comments
docs.text: • This field allows multiple entries separated by ; (Examples: Soil collected from the field will link with the soil used in an incubation. The soil a plant was grown in links to the plant sample. An original culture sample was transferred to a new vial and generated a new sample)

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://example.com/nmdc_submission_schema

docs.title: Mappings
docs.text: Mapping Type Mapped Value self nmdc_sub_schema:sample_link native nmdc_sub_schema:sample_link

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: sample_link
description: A unique identifier to assign parent-child, subsample, or sibling samples.
  This is relevant when a sample or other material was used to generate the new sample.
title: sample linkage
comments:
- 'This field allows multiple entries separated by ; (Examples: Soil collected from
  the field will link with the soil used in an incubation. The soil a plant was grown
  in links to the plant sample. An original culture sample was transferred to a new
  vial and generated a new sample)'
examples:
- value: IGSN:DSJ0284
from_schema: https://example.com/nmdc_submission_schema
rank: 5
string_serialization: '{text}:{text}'
alias: sample_link
domain_of:
- AirInterface
- BiofilmInterface
- BuiltEnvInterface
- HcrCoresInterface
- HcrFluidsSwabsInterface
- HostAssociatedInterface
- MiscEnvsInterface
- PlantAssociatedInterface
- SedimentInterface
- SoilInterface
- WastewaterSludgeInterface
- WaterInterface
- SampIdNewTermsMixin
slot_group: sample_id_section
range: string
recommended: true
multivalued: false
pattern: '[^\:\n\r]+\:[^\:\n\r]+'

docs.title: Slot: sample shipped amount (sample_shipped)
docs.text:
The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample sent to EMSL.

URI: nmdc_sub_schema:sample_shipped Alias: sample_shipped

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot EmslInterface emsl dh_interface no

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: String

  • Required: True

  • Regex pattern: ^[-+]?[0-9]*\.?[0-9]+([eE][-+]?[0-9]+)? \S+$

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: Value 15 g 100 uL 5 mL

docs.title: Comments
docs.text: • This field is only required when completing metadata for samples being submitted to EMSL for analyses.

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://example.com/nmdc_submission_schema

docs.title: Slot: saturates wt% (saturates_pc)
docs.text:
Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)

URI: MIXS:0000131 Alias: saturates_pc

docs.title: Slot: source material identifier (source_mat_id)
docs.text:
A globally unique identifier assigned to the parent sample or sample that is the source of this sample.

URI: MIXS:0000026 Alias: source_mat_id

docs.title: Inheritance
docs.text:
• nucleic_acid_sequence_source_field
    • source_mat_id

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot SoilInterface soil dh_interface no BuiltEnvInterface built_env dh_interface no MiscEnvsInterface misc_envs dh_interface no JgiMgLrInterface Metadata for samples sent to JGI for long read metagenome sequencing no HcrCoresInterface hcr_cores dh_interface no HcrFluidsSwabsInterface hcr_fluids_swabs dh_interface no WastewaterSludgeInterface wastewater_sludge dh_interface no HostAssociatedInterface host_associated dh_interface no EmslInterface emsl dh_interface no WaterInterface water dh_interface no BiofilmInterface biofilm dh_interface no SedimentInterface sediment dh_interface no JgiMgInterface Metadata for samples sent to JGI for standard metagenome sequencing no DhMultiviewCommonColumnsMixin Mixin with DhMutliviewCommon Columns no MetatranscriptomeSequencingInterleavedDataInterface Interface for interleaved metatranscriptome sequencing data no MetagenomeSequencingInterleavedDataInterface Interface for interleaved metagenome sequencing data no AirInterface air dh_interface no MetagenomeSequencingNonInterleavedDataInterface Interface for non-interleaved metagenome sequencing data no MetatranscriptomeSequencingNonInterleavedDataInterface Interface for non-interleaved metatranscriptome sequencing data no JgiMtInterface jgi_mt dh_interface no PlantAssociatedInterface plant_associated dh_interface no

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: String

  • Regex pattern: ^igsn:[a-zA-Z0-9]+|biosample:SAMN[a-zA-Z0-9]+|biosample:SAME[a-zA-Z0-9]+|biosample:SAMJ[a-zA-Z0-9]+|gold:Gb[0-9]+$

docs.title: Aliases
docs.text: • source material identifiers

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: Value igsn:AU1243 biosample:SAMEA2397676

docs.title: Comments
docs.text:
• Identifiers must be prefixed. Possible FAIR prefixes are IGSNs (http://www.geosamples.org/getigsn), NCBI biosample accession numbers, ARK identifiers (https://arks.org/). These IDs enable linking to derived analytes and subsamples. If you have not assigned FAIR identifiers to your samples, you can generate UUIDs (https://www.uuidgenerator.net/).
  • Identifiers must be prefixed. Possible FAIR prefixes are: igsn for International Generic Sample Numbers (http://www.geosamples.org/getigsn), biosample for NCBI biosample accession IDs, gold for GOLD identifiers.

docs.title: TODOs
docs.text: • Currently, the comments say to use UUIDs. However, if we implement assigning NMDC identifiers with the minter we dont need to require a GUID. It can be an optional field to fill out only if they already have a resolvable ID.

docs.title: Annotations
docs.text: property value expected_value for cultures of microorganisms: identifiers for two culture collections; for other material a unique arbitrary identifer

docs.title: Slot: specific_ecosystem
docs.text:
Specific ecosystems represent specific features of the environment like aphotic zone in an ocean or gastric mucosa within a host digestive system. Specific ecosystem is in position 5/5 in a GOLD path.

URI: nmdc_sub_schema:specific_ecosystem Alias: specific_ecosystem

docs.title: Inheritance
docs.text:
• gold_path_field
    • specific_ecosystem

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot HostAssociatedInterface host_associated dh_interface yes SedimentInterface sediment dh_interface yes SoilInterface soil dh_interface yes BuiltEnvInterface built_env dh_interface yes MiscEnvsInterface misc_envs dh_interface yes PlantAssociatedInterface plant_associated dh_interface yes AirInterface air dh_interface yes HcrCoresInterface hcr_cores dh_interface yes HcrFluidsSwabsInterface hcr_fluids_swabs dh_interface yes WaterInterface water dh_interface no BiofilmInterface biofilm dh_interface yes WastewaterSludgeInterface wastewater_sludge dh_interface yes

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: String

  • Recommended: True

docs.title: Comments
docs.text: • Specific ecosystems help to define samples based on very specific characteristics of an environment under the five-level classification system.

docs.text:
name: specific_ecosystem
description: Specific ecosystems represent specific features of the environment like
  aphotic zone in an ocean or gastric mucosa within a host digestive system. Specific
  ecosystem is in position 5/5 in a GOLD path.
comments:
- Specific ecosystems help to define samples based on very specific characteristics
  of an environment under the five-level classification system.
from_schema: https://example.com/nmdc_submission_schema
see_also:
- https://gold.jgi.doe.gov/help
rank: 13

domain_of:

- HcrCoresInterface
- HcrFluidsSwabsInterface
- HostAssociatedInterface
- MiscEnvsInterface
- PlantAssociatedInterface
- SedimentInterface

- WastewaterSludgeInterface
- WaterInterface

range: string
recommended: true

docs.title: Slot: source rock kerogen type (sr_kerog_type)
docs.text:
Origin of kerogen. Type I: Algal (aquatic), Type II: planktonic and soft plant material (aquatic or terrestrial), Type III: terrestrial woody/ fibrous plant material (terrestrial), Type IV: oxidized recycled woody debris (terrestrial) (additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerogen). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field

docs.title: Slot: incubation start date (start_date_inc)
docs.text:
Date the incubation was started. Only relevant for incubation samples.

URI: nmdc_sub_schema:start_date_inc Alias: start_date_inc

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot SedimentInterface sediment dh_interface no SoilInterface soil dh_interface no SoilMixsInspiredMixin Mixin with SoilMixsInspired Terms no PlantAssociatedInterface plant_associated dh_interface no WaterInterface water dh_interface no

docs.title: Comments
docs.text: • Date should be formatted as YYYY(-MM(-DD)). Ie, 2021-04-15, 2021-04 and 2021 are all acceptable.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text: • MIXS:0000011

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://example.com/nmdc_submission_schema

docs.title: Mappings
docs.text: Mapping Type Mapped Value self nmdc_sub_schema:start_date_inc native nmdc_sub_schema:start_date_inc

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: start_date_inc
description: Date the incubation was started. Only relevant for incubation samples.
title: incubation start date
notes:
- MIxS collection_date accepts (truncated) ISO8601. DH taking arbitrary precision
  date only
comments:
- Date should be formatted as YYYY(-MM(-DD)). Ie, 2021-04-15, 2021-04 and 2021 are
  all acceptable.
examples:
- value: '2021-04-15'
- value: 2021-04
- value: '2021'
from_schema: https://example.com/nmdc_submission_schema
see_also:
- MIXS:0000011
rank: 4
string_serialization: '{date, arbitrary precision}'
alias: start_date_inc
domain_of:
- PlantAssociatedInterface
- SedimentInterface
- SoilInterface
- WaterInterface
- SoilMixsInspiredMixin
slot_group: mixs_inspired_section
range: string
recommended: true
pattern: ^[12]\d{3}(?:(?:-(?:0[1-9]|1[0-2]))(?:-(?:0[1-9]|[12]\d|3[01]))?)?$

docs.title: Slot: incubation start time, GMT (start_time_inc)
docs.text:
Time the incubation was started. Only relevant for incubation samples.

URI: nmdc_sub_schema:start_time_inc Alias: start_time_inc

docs.title: Applicable Classes
docs.text: Name Description Modifies Slot SoilMixsInspiredMixin Mixin with SoilMixsInspired Terms no SoilInterface soil dh_interface no

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Range: String

  • Recommended: True

  • Regex pattern: ^([01]?\d|2[0-3]|24(?=:00?:00?$)):([0-5]\d)(:([0-5]\d))?$

docs.title: Comments
docs.text: • Time should be entered as HH:MM(:SS) in GMT. See here for a converter: https://www.worldtimebuddy.com/pst-to-gmt-converter

docs.title: See Also
docs.text: • MIXS:0000011

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://example.com/nmdc_submission_schema

docs.title: Mappings

docs.text:
name: start_time_inc
description: Time the incubation was started. Only relevant for incubation samples.
title: incubation start time, GMT
notes:
- MIxS collection_date accepts (truncated) ISO8601. DH taking seconds optional time
  only
comments:
- 'Time should be entered as HH:MM(:SS) in GMT. See here for a converter: https://www.worldtimebuddy.com/pst-to-gmt-converter'
examples:
- value: '13:33'
- value: '13:33:55'
from_schema: https://example.com/nmdc_submission_schema
see_also:
- MIXS:0000011
rank: 5
string_serialization: '{time, seconds optional}'
alias: start_time_inc
domain_of:
- SoilInterface
- SoilMixsInspiredMixin
slot_group: mixs_inspired_section
range: string
recommended: true
pattern: ^([01]?\d|2[0-3]|24(?=:00?:00?$)):([0-5]\d)(:([0-5]\d))?$

• Why is it soil water content method in the name but not the title? Is this slot used in other samples?
